intro: Rubus surrejanus, commonly known as the Serbian blackberry, is a species of bramble native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
